name: firebaseappcheck_projects_apps_exchangeRecaptchaToken
description: Validates a [reCAPTCHA v3 response token](https://developers.google.com/recaptcha/docs/v3). If valid, returns an AppCheckToken.

app.description: Required. The relative resource name of the web app, in the format: ``` projects/{project_number}/apps/{app_id} ``` If necessary, the `project_number` element can be replaced with the project ID of the Firebase project. Learn more about using project identifiers in Google's [AIP 2510](https://google.aip.dev/cloud/2510) standard.

fields.description: Selector specifying which fields to include in a partial response.

key.description: API key. Your API key identifies your project and provides you with API access, quota, and reports. Required unless you provide an OAuth 2.0 token.

oauth_token.description: OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.

prettyPrint.description: Returns response with indentations and line breaks.

quotaUser.description: Available to use for quota purposes for server-side applications. Can be any arbitrary string assigned to a user, but should not exceed 40 characters.

GoogleFirebaseAppcheckV1betaExchangeReca.description: Request message for the ExchangeRecaptchaToken method.

recaptchaToken.description: Required. The reCAPTCHA token as returned by the [reCAPTCHA v3 JavaScript API](https://developers.google.com/recaptcha/docs/v3).

$block: Encapsulates an *App Check token*, which are used to access Firebase services protected by App Check.

$ul: **attestationToken**: An App Check token. App Check tokens are signed [JWTs](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7519) containing claims that identify the attested app and Firebase project. This token is used to access Firebase services protected by App Check.

**token**: An App Check token. App Check tokens are signed [JWTs](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7519) containing claims that identify the attested app and Firebase project. This token is used to access Firebase services protected by App Check.

**ttl**: The duration from the time this token is minted until its expiration. This field is intended to ease client-side token management, since the client may have clock skew, but is still able to accurately measure a duration.
